intro: Calycera intermedia, commonly known as the common calycera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair. Calycera intermedia is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
